name: s3filecopy
description: Upload files to AWS Simple Storage Service (S3) Bucket
author: Hosam Kamel
helpMarkDown: Please refer to [Working with Amazon S3 Buckets](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/UsingBucket.html)

inputs.name: AWSConnection
inputs.label: AWS service endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the AWS endpoint to use. If needed, click on 'manage', and add a new Service Endpoint of type 'AWS'

inputs.name: BucketName
inputs.label: Bucket Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the bucket where the files will be uploaded. If it doesn't exist, it will be created.

inputs.name: SourceFolder
inputs.label: Source Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source folder that the copy pattern(s) will be run from.  Empty is the root of the repo.  Use [variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988) if files are not in the repo. Example: $(agent.builddirectory)

inputs.name: Contents
inputs.label: Contents
inputs.helpMarkDown: File paths to include as part of the copy. Supports multiple lines of minimatch patterns.

inputs.name: filesAcl
inputs.label: ACL
inputs.helpMarkDown: The canned ACL to apply to the object. Refer to [Canned ACL](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/acl-overview.html#canned-acl)

inputs.name: TargetFolder
inputs.label: Target Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target folder files will copy to in the S3 bucket. If empty, files will be copied to the root folder in the S3 bucket. You can use [variables](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988)

inputs.name: createBucket
inputs.label: Create S3 bucket if not exists
inputs.helpMarkDown: Create S3 bucket if not exists.

inputs.name: overwrite
inputs.label: Overwrite
inputs.helpMarkDown: Replace existing files in and beneath the target folder.

inputs.name: flattenFolders
inputs.label: Flatten folders
inputs.helpMarkDown: Flatten the folder structure and copy all files into the specified target folder on the aws S3 bucket

messages.TargetIsDir: Unable to copy file %s to %s. The target path already exists as a directory.
